summary: This is an email chain from May 2020 between individuals (likely prosecutors and law enforcement) coordinating the review and exchange of FBI 302 interview reports and handwritten notes related to the Epstein case. The correspondence discusses missing documents, confirms receipt of others, and notes the scale of the investigation with over 120 interviews conducted.

events.title: Interview conducted
events.description: An interview was conducted on this date, referenced by a short FBI 302 report. The email questions whether handwritten notes exist for this interview.

keyFacts: The document is part of a 2020 effort to compile and verify all investigative materials from the Epstein case.
It references that collectively, more than 120 interviews were conducted in the case.
The correspondence is focused on reconciling FBI 302 reports with their corresponding handwritten interview notes, noting several are missing.
The email is sent from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
Specific interview dates, like July 6, 2019, are referenced, indicating ongoing investigative review years after Epstein's arrest.
